instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
why  <SIGNAL>CHGR_EN_MVR</SIGNAL>  0v .
no  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL>. 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_3V3G3HRTC_X</SIGNAL>=5v. 
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>=1.7v
CSOP CSON CSIN CSIP =all 5v
VDDA ,VDDP=5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL>?
Voltage and diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
If no volt (no short), remove F7000/1 and check <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Possibly bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40.
Check resistance (ohm scale) between <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
between <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/60 its 47k and increases
may I ask u that 
am getting 5v on ppbus before it switching to 20 I think this needs <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> present is it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Look better at schematic; where that volatge comes from?

Strange to get 5V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 be good.
Try changing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

BTW, are you using 96/140W charger?
